org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive

Class Odometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive.Odometry

  • public class Odometry
extends Object
    This class represents an odometry calculator for differential drive mobile robots. It calculates position based on the movement of the left and right wheels. It relies on a simple differential wheel model.
    Author:
    jona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Odometry(Model aDifferentialDriveModel, ISensor aLeftSpeedSensor, ISensor aRightSpeedSensor)
      This constructor initializes an odometry calculator capable of estimating position based on the input readings of a pair of odometers and a differential drive wheel model.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISensor getAngleSensor()
      This method returns a sensor which can return the current angle based on the odometry calculations.
      double getDirection()
      This method returns the direction calculated by odometry.
      void setDirection(double aDirection)
      This method overrides the direction calculated by the odometry.
      void setPosition(Vector2 aPosition)
      This method overrides the position calculated by odometry.
      void tick(double dt)
      This method advances the odometry simulation by the time unit given.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometry

        public Odometry(Model aDifferentialDriveModel,
        ISensor aLeftSpeedSensor,
        ISensor aRightSpeedSensor)
        This constructor initializes an odometry calculator capable of estimating position based on the input readings of a pair of odometers and a differential drive wheel model.
        Parameters:
        aDifferentialDriveModel - A model of the differential drive which allows calculation of relative wheel velocities from speed and angle and vice-versa.
        aLeftSpeedSensor - This sensor returns the speed of the left wheel in meters per second.
        aRightSpeedSensor - This sensor returns the speed of the right wheel in meters per second.

    • Method Detail

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(double aDirection)
        This method overrides the direction calculated by the odometry. This is useful when other measures of the current position yield better estimates based on other sensors. The direction is measured according to a fixed reference coordinate system and is always in units of radians.
        Parameters:
        aDirection - New direction.

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        This method returns the direction calculated by odometry. The direction is measured according to a fixed reference coordinate system and is always in units of radians.
        Returns:
        Returns the direction angle (counter-clockwise from (1,0) ) in radians.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector2 aPosition)
        This method overrides the position calculated by odometry. This is useful when other measures of the current position yield better estimates based on other sensors.
        Parameters:
        aPosition - New position.

      • getAngleSensor

        public ISensor getAngleSensor()
        This method returns a sensor which can return the current angle based on the odometry calculations.
        Returns:
        An angle sensor which returns the angle based on odometry. The angle sensor is suitable for use in a PID controller because it wraps the angle to be strictly between -PI and PI.

      • tick

        public void tick(double dt)
        This method advances the odometry simulation by the time unit given.
        Parameters:
        dt - The elapsed time (in seconds).
